doc.title: EVE (A)
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/Upgrade to Buy on improving margins with solid sales growth in EVESS RMB70 POUpgrade to Buy on improving margins with so_2025-08-29

passages.text: Rating Change: BUY | PO: 70.00 CNY | Price: 53.25 CNY

We upgrade EVE to Buy from Underperform with a higher PO of RMB70 (earlier RMB37, see our updated valuation inside), as we expect: (1) profitability to improve in 2H25- 2027, thanks to scale effect and better customer mix; (2) ESS battery shipment to post higher growth in 2025- 27E; and (3) rapid electrification trend of commercial vehicle (CV) in China should support solid demand for its EV battery in 2025- 27E. We lift 2025/26/27 shipment forecasts by \(1\% /3\% /5\%\) and 2026/27 NPM forecasts by 0.1ppt/0.9ppt. As a result, we adjust our 2026/27E earnings forecasts by \(3\% /16\%\) , respectively.

EVE's GPM has been under pressure in 2024- 1H25, mainly due to lower capacity utilization, pricing pressure from its customers, and slower growth in EV battery. Looking ahead, we expect EVE's profitability to improve in 2H25- 2027, thanks to: (1) rising capacity utilization: the capacity utilization of its EV battery production line will be maintained above \(70\%\) in 2026, vs. below \(60\%\) before 2025; (2) rising sales to overseas EV customers like BMW and Mercedes with a higher profitability; and (3) broadening customer base for its ESS battery. In our view, the recent lithium price hike has limited impact to its GPM, given the company has prepared some low- cost inventory, and it can ease the upstream price pressure by hedging and repricing with clients.

EVE's ESS battery shipment grew \(37\%\) YoY in 1H25. In Jul- Aug, its ESS battery shipment further grew 15- 20% from its 2Q25 level, despite the rush installation of utility- scale ESS in China in 2Q25. We see \(31\%\) CAGR in its ESS battery shipment in 2025- 27, thanks to the continued demand growth of independent ESS in China, and the solid demand growth overseas. We also expect its EV battery shipment to deliver \(21\%\) CAGR in 2025- 27, supported by new EV models (notably XPeng G9/P7+), and the electrification of CV (contributing \(\sim 50\%\) of its EV battery sales in 1H25).
\\* For full definitions of \(\widehat{\mathrm{Method}}^{\mathrm{th}}\) measures, see page 10.
>> Employed by a non- US affiliate of BofAS and is not registered/qualified as a research analyst under the FINRA rules.

Key Metrics \\* For full definitions of iQmethod measures, see page 10.

Founded in 2001, EVE Energy (EVE) has been focusing on lithium battery products since then. EVE's products include lithium primary cell, EV battery, ESS, and battery for power tools as well as e-cigarettes. EVE was listed on the Shenzhen Growth Enterprise Market Board (GEM Board) in 2009.

We have an Buy rating on EVE, given (1) we expect improving profitability in 2H25- 2027, thanks to scale effect and improving customer mix, (2) we expect its ESS battery shipment to deliver continued solid growth in 2025- 27E, and (3) we expect the rapid electrification trend of commercial vehicle (CV) to support solid demand for its EV battery in 2025- 27E.
Price to Book Value 2.6x

In 1H25, EVE shipped 21.5GWh/28.7GWh of EV/ESS battery, +53% 37% YoY, respectively. Commercial vehicle contributed around 50% of its EV battery shipment in 1H25. According to SNE Research, EVE's top customers in 1H25 were XPeng/Mercedes/BMW, comprising 36%/12%/10% of its installable battery capacity globally. We believe EVE will ship 46GWh/71GWh of EV/ESS battery in 2025, and expect its EV/ESS battery shipment to post 21%/31% CAGR in 2025- 27+
Exhibit 1: EVE's 1H25 EV battery installed capacity by OEM XPeng/Mercedes/BMW are top customers in 1H25, comprising 36%/12%/10% of its total installed capacity
Exhibit 2: EVE's battery shipment forecast We expect EVE to ship 46GWh/71GWh of EV/ESS battery in 2025
Source: EVE, BofA Global Research
Exhibit 3: Battery (include EV + ESS + consumer electronics battery) production by top 5 suppliers EVE's August planned production is 9.8GWh, \(+41\%\) YoY and \(+17\%\) MoM
Source: ICCSino "We include selected EV battery suppliers
EVE targets to ship \(
Exhibit 4: New versus old estimates
We revise up 2026/27E net income by 3%/16%
Source: BofA Global Research estimates; in 2025, EVE booked around RMB1bn ESOP expense
Exhibit 5:P&L summary (quarterly)
Source: BofA Global Research estimates, company report
We derive a PO of RMB70 (was RMB37) from the average of DCF and EV/EBITDA valuation methodologies.

(1) DCF-based fair value: A fair value of RMB67 (was RMB33) is derived from our DCF calculation, with assumptions of \(2\%\) FCF perpetuity growth rate and \(11\%\) (prev. \(10.8\%\) ) WACC due to capital structure change. We raise our DCF-based fair value, as we expect higher FCF in 2025-35E, thanks to: 1) solid GPM/OPM outlook, 2) improved working capital on better battery demand, battery industry consolidation, more disciplined new capacity addition in China.

(2) EV/EBITDA-based fair value: We assign a target EV/EBITDA multiple of \(16x\) (was \(12x\) , 0.5SD below 2-year average) to 2026E EBITDA and derive a fair value of RMB72 (was RMB41). EVE is entering sales growth stage along with OPM recovery, we believe it is well justified to apply 0.5SD above its 2-year average EV/EBITDA (16x) as the target multiple, rather than giving the valuation discount.
Exhibit 6: Valuation summary Our new PO is RMB70
Valuation methodologyImplied value (RMB)Potential upsideParametersMethodology 1DCF67WACC of 11%Methodology 2EV/EBITDA7216 xPO7031%
Source: BofA Global Research estimates
Exhibit 7: EVE's 1-year forward EV/EBITDA band EVE is now trading at 1SD below its historical average
Exhibit 8: EVE's 1-year forward EV/EBITDA base 2-year average is 14.2x
BofA GLOBAL RESEARCH
Exhibit 10:EV battery peer comparison China EV battery makers are trading at an average of 16x 2025E EV/EBITDA
Source: BofA Global Research estimates, company report, Bloomberg (marked as '.) ADTV = average daily trading volume.
Our PO of RMB70 is derived from the average of DCF and EV/EBITDA as we believe EV/EBITDA and DCF better capture its value.
DCF: FV of RMB67, on assumptions of \(2\%\) FCF perpetual growth and \(11\%\) WACC.
EV/EBITDA: FV of RMB72 is derived from 16x target EV/EBITDA on 2026E EBITDA. 16x is 0.5SD above its 2- year average EV/EBITDA, as we expect improving sales and OPM/GPM in the near term.
Upside risks: Better-than- expected EV sales, partnerships with OEMs/faster share gains.
Downside risks: negative profitability impact from raw material price hike, EV purchase subsidy cut, investment income in Smoore.

FUNDAMENTAL EQUITY OPINION KEY: Opinions include a Volatility Risk Rating, an Investment Rating and an Income Rating. VOLATILITY RISK RATINGS, indicators of potential price fluctuation, are: A - Low, B - Medium and C - High. INVESTMENT RATINGS reflect the analyst's assessment of both a stock's absolute total return potential as well as its attractiveness for investment relative to other stocks within its Coverage Cluster (defined below). Our investment ratings are: 1 - Buy stocks are expected to have a total return of at least \(10\%\) and are the most attractive stocks in the coverage cluster; 2 - Neutral stocks are expected to remain flat or increase in value and are less attractive than Buy rated stocks and 3 - Underperform stocks are the least attractive stocks in a coverage cluster. An investment rating of 6 (No Rating) indicates that a stock is no longer trading on the basis of fundamentals. Analysts assign investment ratings considering, among other things, the 0- 12 month total return expectation for a stock and the firm's guidelines for ratings dispersions (shown in the table below). The current price objective for a stock should be referenced to better understand the total return expectation at any given time. The price objective reflects the analyst's view of the potential price appreciation (depreciation).
Investment ratingTotal return expectation (within 12-month period of date of initial rating)Ratings dispersion guidelines for coverage clusterR2Buy≥ 10%≤ 70%Neutral≥ 0%≤ 30%UnderperformN/A≥ 20%

R2Ratings dispersions may vary from time to time where BofA Global Research believes it better reflects the investment prospects of stocks in a Coverage Cluster. INCOME RATINGS, indicators of potential cash dividends, are: 7 - same/higher (dividend considered to be secure), 8 - same/lower (dividend not considered to be secure) and 9 - pays no cash dividend. Coverage Cluster is comprised of stocks covered by a single analyst or two or more analysts sharing a common industry, sector, region or other classification(s). A stock's coverage cluster is included in the most recent BofA Global Research report referencing the stock.
